hero.title: We define our Intelligence by the questions we ask.
hero.subtitle: A community-driven platform defining and tracking AGI milestones through collective intelligence.

quick_vote.title: Quick Vote
quick_vote.description: Help define the boundary of AGI by voting on these random questions.

index_questions.title: Index Questions
index_questions.description: Can today's AI do this? Vote 'Achieved' if yes, 'Not Yet' if no.
index_questions.empty: No index questions yet. Start voting to create them!

candidate_questions.title: Candidate Questions
candidate_questions.description: These questions are still under review. Vote 'Suitable/Unsuitable' to help decide if they qualify as AGI criteria.

manifesto.title: What is AGI Index?
manifesto.p1: "What is AGI?" It is perhaps the most complex question humanity has ever asked. But paradoxically, asking it forces us to answer a much deeper question: "What does it mean to be human?"
manifesto.quote: "If I had an hour to solve a problem, I'd spend 55 minutes thinking about the problem and 5 minutes solving it."
manifesto.p2: For decades, computer scientists have raced through the final 5 minutes, building faster chips and larger models. They treat intelligence as a computational problem to be solved.
manifesto.p3: But intelligence is not just code. It is the intuition of a mother understanding her crying child. It is the wit of a writer crafting a metaphor. It is the hesitation we feel before making a difficult choice.
manifesto.p4: This is why the definition of AGI cannot be left solely to engineers in a lab. If AGI is to mirror human intelligence, the reflection must come from all of humanity, not just a select few.

list.item1: You don't need a PhD to participate here.
list.item2: You don't need to know how to code.
list.item3: You only need your experience as a living, thinking human being.

manifesto.p5: The AGI INDEX is where we reclaim our "55 minutes." It is a place for the artist, the teacher, the parent, and the philosopher to stand alongside the engineer. Together, we are not just measuring a machine; we are mapping the boundaries of our own humanity.
manifesto.closing: Ready to define it together? What does your vision of the 'next intelligence' look like?

how_it_works.title: How It Works
how_it_works.intro: The AGI Index is shaped by the world, not by a closed group of experts. Every step is designed to let humanity collectively define — and measure — the next intelligence.

step1.title: Anyone Can Propose a Question
step1.desc: If you believe a particular ability reflects real intelligence, you can submit it as a question for the AGI Index. No technical background needed — only human experience.

step2.title: The Community Curates the Index
step2.desc: Every proposed question goes through community voting. A question becomes an official Index question if it receives 50% or more "suitable" votes and at least 10 total votes.

step3.title: Evaluate Today's Leading AI Systems
step3.desc: For each question, users vote based on current major AI systems (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Llama, etc.). Vote "Achieved" if at least one major AI can do it, "Not Yet" if none can reliably do it today.

step4.title: Computing the AGI Index
step4.desc: Among official Index questions, if 50% or more votes say "Achieved," that question is classified as Achieved.
step4.formula: AGI Index = Achieved Questions / Total Index Questions
step4.index_language: Language AGI Index — for language-only questions
step4.index_multimodal: Multimodal AGI Index — for vision, audio, and action-related questions
step4.index_overall: Overall AGI Index — combining all official questions

aigo.title: Still have questions?
aigo.description: Join our Discord community. AIGO, our community manager, is there to help you navigate the definitions of intelligence.

transparency.title: Transparency Note
transparency.content: This project is initiated and funded by H1R.ai as a contribution to the open research community. We guarantee that the AGI Index will remain ad-free, independent, and its data will always be open to the public.

coalition.title: A Call to Join Us
coalition.p1: Building a fair and meaningful AGI benchmark isn't something any single group should do alone. We welcome AI labs, companies, researchers, and communities who want to contribute—not as competitors, but as collaborators.
coalition.p2: Whether you can offer data, compute, technical insight, or simply thoughtful review, your participation helps make the AGI Index more balanced, transparent, and useful for everyone.
coalition.closing: The AGI Index is, and will remain, a neutral and community-driven project.

login.desc_signin: Enter your email to sign in to your account

login.toggle_signin: Already have an account? Sign in

questions.title: Questions Index
questions.description: Browse and vote on AGI milestones.

empty.index: No index questions found matching your criteria.
empty.candidate: No candidate questions found matching your criteria.

empty.votes: You haven't voted on any questions yet.
empty.questions: You haven't submitted any questions yet.

status.pending_message: This question is currently under review.

history.title: AGI Index History
history.description: Track the progress of AGI development over time.

suggest.title: Suggest a Question
suggest.description: Help us build better benchmarks for AGI by proposing meaningful questions.

guide.title: Question Writing Guide
guide.description: No complex theories needed. Think of moments when you thought 'If AI can't do this, can we call it intelligent?'

clear_answer.title: Clear Answer
clear_answer.desc: Can the question be answered with "Yes" or "No"?

map_point.title: A Point on the Map
map_point.desc: Show different aspects of intelligence. Your question becomes a point on the vast map of intelligence.

new_perspective.title: New Perspective
new_perspective.desc: Is it a novel situation that didn't exist before? Avoid duplicates.

guide.footer: Your experience lights the path AI will follow.

categories.linguistic_desc: Abilities that can be judged through text conversation only
categories.multimodal_desc: All abilities requiring sound, expressions, images, actions, etc. beyond text

linguistic: Can it remember a conversation from a week ago?
Can it continue a work discussion from Slack on another platform?
Can it adapt its tone for professional vs. casual conversations?
Can it distinguish between jokes and serious statements?
multimodal: Can it recognize someone by their voice alone?
Can it detect true emotions when expressions contradict words?
Can it explain directions by drawing on a map?
Can it learn how to use chopsticks by watching?
Can it find a restroom in an unfamiliar place?

form.title: Submit Your Question
form.description: Your question will be reviewed and added to the public vote.
form.question_placeholder: Describe a specific situation like the examples above.
form.success_message: Thank you! Your question will be reviewed by the community.
